'''Katello''' is [[Open-source software|open source]] [[systems management]] software application developed by [[Red Hat]]. It is the upstream version of the [[Red Hat Network|RHN]] CloudForms System Engine (CFSE) and RedHat Subscription Asset Manager (SAM).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=61nghQzZ1js|title=YouTube: Overview of RedHat Subscription Asset Manager (SAM)|publisher=Redhat|accessdate=27 April 2013}}</ref> Katello includes the web interface and an associated CLI tool. Both are made available to users and developers under a [[free and open source software]] (FOSS) license. The relationship between Katello and CloudForms System Engine is analogous to the relationship between [[Fedora Project|Fedora]] and [[Red Hat Enterprise Linux]]. Whereas System Engine runs on Red Hat, Katello supports [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora]] and [[CentOS]] Linux systems.
It is free software licensed under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]] version 2.
Katello can use Postgres or MySQL for storage although the package management tool it uses, Pulp, requires [[MongoDB]].
== Components ==
=== Candlepin <ref>{{cite web|title=candlepin |url=https://fedorahosted.org/candlepin/|publisher=fedora org|accessdate=27 April 2013}}</ref> === * Subscription management upstream for RedHat Subscription Asset Manager (SAM)
=== Pulp <ref>{{cite web|title=Pulp Developer Website|url=https://fedorahosted.org/pulp/|publisher=fedora org|accessdate=27 April 2013}}</ref> === * Software/ Repository & Content management layer with a [[Nosql]] backend of [[Mongodb]]
=== Foreman <ref>{{cite web|title=Foreman Developer Website|url=https://fedorahosted.org/forman/|publisher=fedora org|accessdate=27 April 2013}}</ref> === * Provisioning and Configuration management ** Next Generation [[Cobbler (software)|Cobbler]]
== Version history == <ref>http://freecode.com/projects/Katello/releases</ref>
=== 1.2: 16 Dec 2012 19:45 === Release Notes: Architectures, Config Templates, and Domains support have been added to the API and CLI. Subnets and Domains can now be created and managed within the UI. More robust custom info and defaults. Use of bundler.d for production installations. CLI bash completion file updates. Fedora 17 support. Bugfixes and API enhancements
=== 1.1: 16 Oct 2012 12:30 ===
Release Notes: Initial Foreman packaging integration was implemented. Object labels and auto labelization were added. New API documentation was provided along with Prawn integration for PDF generation and a new systems custom info feature
